task.title: Example: Adding a Button in Codeblock Areas in DITA WebHelp Output

keywords.indexterm: WebHelp Responsive systemAdd button in code snippets

context.p: This task will get you started with how to add an action (such as a button or link) in the code snippet areas that are displayed in DITA map to WebHelp Responsive output. You can then attach your code that does the actual processing for the action.

step.cmd: Locate this template: <xsl:template match="*[contains(@class, ' topic/pre ')]" mode="pre-fmt">. Examine the default behavior of this template.

Open the \plugins\com.oxygenxml.webhelp.responsive\xsl\dita\desktop\fixup.xsl file and create a template that is similar to the one you examined in step 2: <xsl:template match="*[contains(@class, ' topic/pre ')]" mode="pre-fmt">. It will be used to override the default processing. This new template will include your code for creating the button. It will have the action code that does the actual processing attached to it (this can be written in JavaScript, for example).
Save the file and run the transformation.
